metadata.title: CVE-2015-2716 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the XML parser in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0, FirefoxESR 31.x before 31.7, and Thunderbird before 31.7 allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary code by providing a large amount of compressed XMLdata, a related issue to CVE-2015-1283.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 38.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 38.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 38.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 38.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '38.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
